cyclone.name: IDALIA
cyclone.current_location: about 125 miles south of the western tip of Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: Moving north, then turning north-northeast across the eastern Gulf of Mexico toward Florida’s Big Bend, afterwards sweeping across southeast Georgia and the coastal Carolinas and emerging into the Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend (between Cedar Key and Indian Pass)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from Englewood to Indian Pass FL including Tampa Bay; Tropical Storm Watch south of Englewood to Chokoloskee FL and Lower Keys west of Seven-Mile Bridge
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning Pinar del Río (Cuba); Tropical Storm Warning Yucatán Peninsula Tulum–Río Lagartos, Isle of Youth, Dry Tortugas FL
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Gulf Coast, southeast Georgia, and the coastal Carolinas
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Unlikely (main surge threat focused on FL Gulf Coast)
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (40–60 mph gusts) possible late Wed night into Thu
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal inundation possible, generally below 3 ft along GA coast
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches of rain possible Tue night–Thu with locally higher amounts, causing flash/urban flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents and rough seas in coastal waters, periods of lightning in embedded squalls
